Class SigmaAir

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework7.SigmaAir
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SigmaAir
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The SigmaAir class contains an adjacency matrix for all airports.
    See Also:

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCity(java.lang.String city)
      Adds a new City object to the list if it does not already exist
      void addConnection(java.lang.String cityFrom, java.lang.String cityTo)
      If appropriate cities are given, calculates the distance between the cities, and includes this entry in the connections matrix
      void loadAllCities(java.lang.String filename)
      Parses a file and adds all cities to the city list.
      void loadAllConnections(java.lang.String filename)
      Parses a file and adds all connections to the connections matrix.
      void printAllCities(java.util.Comparator<City> comp)
      Prints all cities in the order based on the given Comparator
      void printAllConnections()
      Prints all connections available from all recorded cities
      void removeConnection(java.lang.String cityFrom, java.lang.String cityTo)
      If appropriate cities are given, removes the entry from the connections table
      java.lang.String shortestPath(java.lang.String cityFrom, java.lang.String cityTo)
      If appropriate cities are given, finds the shortest path between the cities, and returns a String representation of the path, if it exists Implements the Floyd Warshall algorithm to deteremine the distance of the shortest path
      int size()
      Returns the number of cities in the list
